result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julio Cesar Castro Jr.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Cases 20CF165, 21CF103, 21CT407, 21CF376, 21CT560, 22CF242, 22CF265, 22CF347, 22CF348, 22CF362 called at 8:51am 
Defendant Julio C Castro in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Julio C Castro.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance.

Atty De La Rosa will be submitting PDOAC in case 22CF362.

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occurs in case 22CF362: 
Mr. Castro waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 8:55am  

NEXT:   As to Case 20CF165: (1)FSSC on 11/8/22 at 2:30pm (2) Jury Trial on 11/14/22 at 8:15am 
As to Cases 21CF103, 21CT407, 21CF376, 21CT560, 22CF242, 22CF265, 22CF347, 22CF348, 22CF362: Status on 11/8/22 at 2:30pm
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] cases #21CF103, #21CT407, #21CF376,#21CT560, #22CF242, #22CF265, #22CF347, #22CF348 called at 10:44am. 
Defendant Julio C Castro in court, in custody, with Attorney Cassi Nelson.  ADA Michael Witt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance. 
In Cases #22CF242, #22CF265, #22CF347, #22CF348 Arraignment is held: 
--Service of Informations is admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
--Pleas of "not guilty" are entered in all four cases
--In response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trials.
recess 10:54am

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing in Case #22CF362, and Status Conference on the remaining cases--all on October 11th at 8:30am

Pre-trial conference on August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on September 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[MK] cases #22CF242, #22CF265, #2CF347, #2CF348, #22CF362 called at 8:45am  
Defendant Julio Cesar Castro Jr. in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Initial Appearance is held in Case #22CF362: 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court requires a $500 Cash Bond, with conditions: 
--not to possess or utter any checks or other financial documents that are known not to be valid 

In Cases #22CF242, #22CF265, #22CF347, #22CF348 Prelim-Waivers are taken: 
--Mr. Castro waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trials.
--the Court indicates that Arraignment will be held on a later date 
recess 8:56am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on August 31st at 9:00am,  (2) Arraignment in Cases #22CF242, #22CF265, #22CF347, #22CF348 and Status Conference in #22CF362--all on September 13th at 10:30am--JA note in Case #22CF362 comments that case is at prelim stage

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF242, 22CF265, 22CF347,22CF348 called at 1:05pm 
Defendant Julio Cesar Castro Jr. appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Initial Appearances occur in Cases 22CF347 & 22CF348: 
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit at the request of Atty Nelson 

As to Case 22CF347, The Court requires a $1500  Signature Bond.
As to Case 22CF348, The Court requires a $1500  Signature Bond.

As to Case 22CF242: The Court requires an additional $500 cash bond, with same non-monetary conditions. 
As to Case 22CF265: The Court requires an additional $500 cash bond, with same non-monetary conditions. 
recess 1:16  pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 8/19/22 at 8:30am (speedy demand)
